intro: Phagnalon linifolium, commonly known as slender leaf starwort, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as grasslands and roadsides. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. Phagnalon linifolium is often found in dry, sandy soils and is considered a characteristic species of certain ecological communities.
